newsitem.title: GUATEMALA: British aristocrat murdered for money in Guatemala.
newsitem.headline: British aristocrat murdered for money in Guatemala.

text.p: Authorities said on Friday they believe a British aristocrat stabbed to death in Guatemala City this week was murdered for his money.
Angus Colville, 58, brother of Viscount Colville of Culross, was returning to his hotel on foot on Tuesday when he was attacked and murdered, authorities said.

"We believe he was stabbed with one single knife wound to the chest," British Vice Consul Julie Johnson told Reuters. "The body wasn't found with any money or credit cards so we presume the motive was money."
Colville was in Guatemala City alone, and might have been arranging a flight home after a boating holiday with friends, Johnson said.
Officials do not believe the attack had anything to do with his lineage. "I'm sure the robbers weren't actually aware of who he was," Johnson said.
The body remained in Guatemala City on Friday while embassy officials worked to arrange shipment back to Britain and while police and Guatemalan authorities continued investigations, Johnson said.
Colville was from Tavistock in Devon. Viscount Colville lives in Suffolk, Embassy officials said, providing no other details.
